summary: This is a draft statement from a defense attorney regarding specific allegations against a client (referred to as 'Xi' or 'Mas') concerning their presence during sexual assaults by Jeffrey Epstein. The statement argues the client was not present, suggests victims may have faulty memories due to the time elapsed and emotional nature of the events, and acknowledges Epstein's abuse of young women and girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the individual who sexually abused young women and girls, with the defense statement acknowledging his abuse of 'almost all young women and girls he came into contact with'.

connections.description: The defense statement is crafted to address allegations that Xi was present during Epstein's sexual abuse of minors, indicating a known association between them.

events.title: Alleged Sexual Assaults by Epstein
events.description: Sexual abuse of minors by Jeffrey Epstein, during which it is alleged that Xi was present. The defense statement contests Xi's presence.

keyFacts: A defense statement argues that an individual ('Xi'/'Mas') was not present during sexual assaults Jeffrey Epstein committed on minors.
The statement suggests victims may have 'faulty memories' due to the events occurring 'a long time ago' and being 'emotionally charged'.
It acknowledges that Jeffrey Epstein abused 'almost all young women and girls he came into contact with'.
The correspondence is a draft statement, indicating legal strategy discussions regarding these allegations.
